Reviews.Title: “Good 4 Star hotel in Castelli Romani area south of Rome”
Reviews.Author: erntravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in March during our travels in the Castelli Romani., The room was large, overlooking the pool (which was not open), wifi, fridge, strange long and narrow bathroom with shower, large parking area, no restaurant, and breakfast in the room. The people at the front desk were very friendly. The "lakeside" rooms overlook the street and parking on top of the opposite building, so we assume that you need a high room to actually see the view of the lake. Breakfast was coffee, juice, hard boiled eggs, cheese, rools, croissants. It may have been served in the room because we were off season and there were few visitors. The hotel is a bit hard to find, although there was a big sign at the messy intersection/traffic light where 216 and 217 intersect. It was within easy driving distance to restaurants in Marino and Castel Gondolfo, but walking would be a problem due to traffic and few sidewalks.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Holidaylover091
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the countryside, about a mile walk to the nearest town of Marino (worth a visit) We arrived mid morning, and were surprised to be welcomed very charmingly by the gentleman at reception, and shown to our room. We had a HUGE room overlooking Rome in the distance, it was extremely clean and comfortable, the decor was a bit dark, but quite acceptable. There is a mini bar although the prices are on the high side. It was too late in the year to use the pool, but the area looked really nice, with covered seating and tables which are obviously in use during warmer months. There is plenty of free car parking, and free wifi, for which you get a card from reception. The hotel has comfortable seating areas in the public rooms, and is warm and hospitable. Buffet breakfast in a very pleasant breakfast room, with a good choice of food and drinks. Now for the downside, NO RESTAURANT !!! We were shocked to be told when we tried to book Dinner, that the restaurant is only open in the evenings during busy periods. Given that we were some distance from town I found this quite disappointing, as it meant either driving (no pre dinner drinks or wine then !) or walking down narrow, unlit roads (no pavement for part of the way) to one of the couple of places within a short walk (10 minutes) This was unexpected as we had hoped to have relaxed dinners at the hotel. The lake which the hotel overlooks is also a drive away, what is not made clear on the website is that the hotel is on top of a very steep hill with the lake at the bottom, however the views are fantastic. When you do visit the lake the whole area is pay and display to park. There are some nice restaurants and a water sport area. I would recommend this lovely hotel, but the lack of a restaurant should be addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay for a visit to Marino!”
Reviews.Author: gnocchi13
Reviews.Content: I visited Marino for a wedding in July, where the bride made accommodations at this hotel. The first thing you notice is the stunning view of Lake Albano from the hotel entrance! The rooms are very comfortable and clean! The breakfast offered lots of variety! The pool was perfect place to keep cool in the nice summer heat. Most importantly, Alessandro (Front Desk) made sure that each guest had everything they needed! He was the perfect host to me as well as the other guest. I would definitely stay at this hotel when visiting this area!!

Reviews.Title: “yes ,we will be back again !”
Reviews.Author: polo15129
Reviews.Content: a nice quite place ,mostley for couples or mature people , i believe there was only few families during my 2 weeks stay , lake view during fullmoon was just undiscribable ! awesome view with no lights around but the moon's. the reflection of the moon on the lake at night was so nice, i felt like i would become a warewolf any second if i was alone . the workeres are helpful and polite , all of them ,no exceptions . didn't like the t.v channels , all italian no foreign channels ( english). i liked the quietness of the area and the swimming pool is just great. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and friendly staff -”
Reviews.Author: More_Holidays05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great as a base for touring the area and also for relaxing. Far enough from Rome for peace and quiet but close enough to see all the sites. My room was very large and very comfortable - the hotel is very clean and the rooms a serviced every day. The staff at reception are very helpful and friendly. They provided me with lots of information about how to get around the area, bus and train timetables, where to eat etc. The pool area is small but very clean and relaxing. The hotels restaurant has a good buffet breakfast with a nice selection, and a choice of coffees and teas, with freshly made espresso and cappucinos. It's not open for dinner but that doesnt really matter - the best food in italy is where the italians eat! And there are plenty of good restaurants within easy reach. I didnt have a car but this wasn't a problem. The hotel arranged for collection from Ciampino airport - on time, easy to arrange and cheaper than a taxi. There are good bus services allowing for connection by train into the heart of Rome. The hotel is between the two towns of Castel Gandolfo and Marino with very nice restaurants. You can walk in 20-30 minutes. Its a bit hilly (but then Rome is built on 7 hills!) - that just gives a good excuse for another gelati! Last bus from Castel Gandolfo is 23.30pm - so no problem with a nice evening out. Dont think that it will be party central - its just a nice little country place where real italians live. The Pope holidays here but its all very low key - except Sundays for the month when he's in residence there but otherwise its very relaxing and just locals and a few stray toursists. Before you go do a little research on the web to see where you would like to visit. The local bus service is Cotral. In Rome you have the choice of buses and metro from Rome Termini. There are open top buses - between €20-€25 for hop on hop off - or the 110 which is a public tour bus. In Rome Termini station the tourist information area will give you plenty of advice for using the local transport. If you want to visit somewhere like the Borghese - check online before you go as you may need to book in advance - but its worth it. Bus fares are €1 and the train is €1.90. Locally all the restaurants are good - but note that they shut about 3.30pm - so have pizza. On the way from the hotel to Marino - look out for a little place on the right hand side of the road just at the base of the hill. There is no sign but it sells local naturally sparkling water and lovely local wine from large vats. One hazard - the black cat! Lucky - unless you fall over her! She insists on lying on the black mat in the entrance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not to recommend”
Reviews.Author: yorkyRoma
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights and the service was atrocious. There was no food on offer when we arrived (which was at about 1pm, normal Itaian lunch time!) - the only thing they could offer wasa microwaved sandwich which quite honestly left a lot to be desired... the rooms were small and not very clean, we had booked 2 doubles use as singles so we would have plenty of space but we may aswell have booked singles, since there was not enough room to even open the sutcases properly and store them. The pool area was tacky and quite dirty as were the public toilets in that area. Whenever we needed assistance we had to go and seacrh for the staff there was never anyone visibly on duty. A guest who checked out in front of us was complaining about the same things PLUS he had booked a taxi through them and it had cost him €60 to Ciampino airport, which is totally overpriced considering the airport is a 10 min drive away. Never again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “superb view, spacy, luxuorious”
Reviews.Author: elzdur
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated on a hill between Castel Gandolfo and Marino overlooking the lake - marvellous view (get a room with a view). Service is very friendly - we got a coffee and a croissant at 6 o'clock in the morning. If you have to catch an early plane from Ciampino airport this is a very suitable place to stay (on condition you have a car with you). A 10 minute walk down the hill and you can take a swim in the lake. The swimming pool does not open before middle of June.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a 4 star????”
Reviews.Author: jmmer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for threee nights. The hotel is nice, on top of the crater and overlooking the lake Albano.It is close to Gastelgandolfo and very close to Ciampino airport. The rooms are large except the bathroom, that was tiny and dark. Decoration is quite kitch, a pity for the magnitude of the hotel. Breakfast was ok, buffet with selection of sweets but little salty food (egg...).Enough for me except the coffee that was a cup and that´s all. The hotel is far from Rome ( about 20 kilometres) but we managed very well as we had a rental car and we drove every morning to ANAGNINA ( where there is a large carpark 1.50 euro a day. It was so full of cars that we had to go to the following Metro station in CINECITÁ ( there is a shopping mall, you can leave the car and it costs 5 euros the whole day. The only problem is that it closes at 8 pm). other times we left the car parked close to that shopping mall but in the street, near SUBAUGUSTA Metro station. Getting to those places from the hotel takes about 15/20 minutes (depending on traffic), and then you can movein the city using Metro. Quite convenient. I paid 105 euros a night a triplex room for 3 people. The check in was easy but the check out was loooonnnng. We were in a hurry going to the airport and the receptionist needed a code for cancelling reservation and a code for charging the total... I still do not know it I have been charged the room twice. I arrived a few hours ago and let´s see tomorrow in t he bank. Very slow and not very professionals. We found a fantastic place for dinner nearby, called IL GIARDINO, VIA BAROZZE 53, ROCCA DI PAPA. GPS is vital for getting those places.

Reviews.Title: “what we were looking for....”
Reviews.Author: PippoPolo
Reviews.Content: Headding to Rome for a family wedding, this hotel offered a chapper option compared to the other 4 star hotels and good location (knowning that car is mandatory to move around). All facilities are there (except restaurant which is not required from the vairety of offer in the surroundings), staff were helpful, plenti of parking space and hotel easily accessible. The weather didn't let us use the pool and the patios but for a loger stay it would be a plus. The hotel itself is well runned and clean the surroundings are offering a big variety of activities and day trips.

Reviews.Title: “A smart hotel let down by little annoying things”
Reviews.Author: TruffsTNT
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel a mixture of things, it has the potential to be a great little retreat but then lets itself down by doing silly things, i shall explain. We arrived here for a four night stay due to a wedding. We were well aware of the 'remote' location and this didnt bother us. Yes taxis are a nightmare here in italy, we were quoted 90 euros one way at the airport for a taxi, we overheard someone else saying that they paid 160 euros! We decided to public transport it, 10 euros each; but it took us three hours; one train, one tube and a hot bus ride but it was still a 70 euros cheaper and far more satisfying! On arrival the setting of the hotel is amazing! sat on top of the volcano overlooking the lake, checking in was easy and the room that we had had a view of the lake! Rooms; large, clean, comfortable and a rather small bathroom but hot water and a good shower, do you really need anything else in a room that all you do is sleep in, o yes the walls are very thin as well!? Then the hiccups happened. On arrival we were some of the first paying guests of the season. Water was 2 euros a bottle for a 500ml. We were told that we could borrow the iron. The next day with more paying guest arriving water went up by a euro, the iron disappeared and we were told it was 2euros an item regardless if it was a T-shirt or a dress shirt, pool towels were being charged at 3 euros per towel, there was no restaurant in the evening due to it not being peak season. And the shuttle bus, with the prices they were charging it should have been a Royal Royce! 25 euros and then 15 euros per person for a 1km trip into Marino!!!!!! Needless to say we used our feet, fine if you are like us: 30's, no children but a nightmare if you have disablities or children. The 1km walk takes approx 15 mins with some very good restaurants in Marino but be prepared for italian drivers and no street lighting at night! The lake also has good food and is about a 20mins walk. Breakfast is large and there is no limit, toast, cakes, cereal etc. The pool is large, clean and deep and the grounds and hotel well looked after. The thing that really annoyed me is the charges as they know they have a captive audience and taxis wont take you anywhere for less than 20 euros. Why not stagger the cost for journeys? there is a station 2 km down the road that will take you directly into termina ie central rome but the hotel are still asking 25 euros! i write this at the hotel about to embark on my trip back to the airport and due not being able to get the station{ Refusing to pay 25 euros + 15 euros with my wife} our route is as follows: bus into Marino, bus into rome, tube to termina and then train to the airport, you have been warned. If it wasnt for these hidden costs i would recommend it to anyone because the location is lovely, further enough from Rome to be in the country but near enough to be tourist. If you have hired a car no problems if you havent then hopefully by reading this you will have made your mind up.

Reviews.Title: “15Km from Rome and centrally location for Castelli Romani”
Reviews.Author: Mody07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set between Lago Albano and Castel Gandolfo in a very quite area. We paid 80 Euro for 1 night for a 4star hotel where we found very helpful people at the reception desk, nice continental breakfast with different kinds of cakes. The room was very spacious and the bed confortable. The bathroom was a little bit tiny and also a shower box. But this price has an excellent quality/price...I would not recommend it for people who want to go every day to Rome, the traffic is bad and for sure you need a car to reach this hotel, otherwise with public transports or taxis is too complicated and also too expensive!

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hotel Villa Dei Papi
HotelInfo.Address: Selva Ferentina 15/17 | Marino, 00047 Rome, Italy
